items.sentence: Tom has no idea how to deal with this problem.
Tom has only fifteen minutes to eat his lunch.
Tom heard that Mary had bought a new computer.
Tom flipped the switch and the lights came on.
Tom flipped through the pages of the magazine.
Tom folded the paper and put it in his pocket.
Tom forgot to buy a birthday present for Mary.
Tom found Mary sitting on a bench in the park.
Tom found a few good deals at the flea market.
Tom made a promise to come home early tonight.
Tom made quite a lot of money in his twenties.
Tom made up his mind to be a helicopter pilot.
It\'s probably not a good idea to do that now.
It\'s unlikely that Tom will ever return home.
Let\'s get Tom something useful for Christmas.
Let\'s hit the town tonight and have some fun.
I\'m feeling so much better than I did before.
I\'m looking forward to seeing you again soon.
No one can tell what\'ll happen in the future.
Tom said he didn\'t know Mary\'s phone number.
I slept only two hours. No wonder I\'m sleepy.
I think it\'s dangerous to swim in that river.
I think it\'s time for me to leave for school.
I can\'t believe you missed Tom\'s graduation.
It\'s not clear who Tom was trying to impress.
It\'s not like you have anything better to do.
It\'s not my opinion, but just my translation.
It\'s one of the things that I like about you.
It\'s our responsibility to take care of this.
It\'s possible that Tom will get into Harvard.
We\'re going to have to deal with it tomorrow.
What do you think you\'d like to do next time?
What\'s the fastest way to get to the airport?
When did you realize Tom didn\'t like it here?
I wonder why Tom told me I shouldn\'t do that.
What\'s the title of the book you\'re reading?
There\'s a pencil on my desk that you can use.
Tom contributed vocals to Mary\'s debut album.
Tom couldn\'t find anyone to play tennis with.
Tom couldn\'t imagine himself shooting anyone.
Tom crossed the river to get to Mary\'s house.
Some people say thirteen is an unlucky number.
The children are learning to add and subtract.
Tom doesn\'t know how to get to Mary\'s house.
If I were younger, I would go abroad to study.
Tom does everything the way Mary tells him to.
Tom is the one who puts the children to sleep.
Tom is the one who taught Mary how to do that.
Tom is the only one here who can speak French.
I shouldn\'t have wasted my time reading that.
Yesterday, you promised you\'d do that for me.
Tom has also studied French for several years.
Tom has been in the hospital for three months.
Tom has two sons. Both of them live in Boston.
Tom is caught between a rock and a hard place.
Translate the following sentences into French.
Was it you that left the door open last night?
We all jumped into the water at the same time.
We almost never speak to each other in French.
We arrived in Boston the day before yesterday.
Tom complained about the way they treated him.
Tom decided to wait for another three minutes.
Tom decorated his house with Christmas lights.
Tom did his best to explain what had happened.
She stands a good chance of winning the prize.
She suggested that I go to the store with him.
She talked him into buying her a diamond ring.
She tried to prevent the rumor from spreading.
She used to play tennis on Saturday afternoon.
She volunteered to go to the meeting with him.
We probably won\'t have much snow this winter.
We can\'t be the only two people who\'re late.
Aren\'t you going to be in Boston this summer?
Aren\'t you going to invite Tom to your party?
Do you really think Mary was flirting with me?
Do you really want to drop out of high school?
Do you remember the day when we first met Tom?
Do you remember what the attacker looked like?
I\'d like to avoid this problem in the future.
I\'d like to perform at Carnegie Hall someday.
I\'d like to thank everyone for their support.
I\'ll always love you, no matter what happens.
I\'ll be here in my office if anyone needs me.
I\'ll deal with this problem as soon as I can.
I don\'t think the police will ever catch Tom.
I don\'t want there to be any lies between us.

Tom probably didn\'t really mean what he said.
Turn off the television. I can\'t concentrate.
Usually I don\'t buy anything on the Internet.
You don\'t have to come if you don\'t want to.

Maybe a little home cooking will cheer you up.
Millions of people starve to death every year.
Tom took his girlfriend out on Saturday night.
Tom wanted to spend more time with his family.
Tom was fatter three years ago than he is now.
Tom was one of my best friends in high school.

I don\'t intend to let that happen ever again.
